alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 2:26AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Maryland... Conococheague Creek at Fairview affecting Washington County. For the Conococheague Creek...including Fairview...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Conococheague Creek at Fairview. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Wishard Road and Kemp Mill Road are both flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 3.3 feet, or 6.7 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Conococheague Creek Fairview 10.0 3.3 Tue 1 am 3.1 3.2 4.5 10.0 7pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
